title: The Dead of Jericho
description: Anne Stavely, a friend of Morse's, ostensibly commits suicide at her home in Jericho, though Morse isn't convinced.

title: The Silent World of Nicholas Quinn
description: The murder of a deaf university entrance examiner leads Morse and Lewis into a possible college cheating scandal.

roles.char: Man Drinking in Syndicate in Opening

title: Service of All the Dead
description: The members of a church who attended a particular service start to die one by one.

title: The Wolvercote Tongue
description: During an exclusive tour an elderly woman dies suddenly and the priceless piece of Medieval jewelry she was going to donate to a local museum vanishes.

roles.char: Man Behind Morse in Chapters Bar

title: Last Seen Wearing
description: When Morse is assigned a cold case of a runaway teenager from school, he suspects that the girl's been murdered.

roles.char: Man walking across quad when Morse visits Sheila Phillipson in library

title: The Settling of the Sun
description: Because Morse is a speaker at a University dinner when a Japanese becomes ill and is later found ritualistically murdered, he becomes everyone's alibi.

roles.char: Doctor sitting on next bed to Jane in final scene

title: Last Bus to Woodstock
description: A young blonde accepts a ride in a pub parking lot and ends up murdered.

roles.char: Man behind Morse in Crowther's lecture

title: Ghost in the Machine
description: A vanished baronet and the theft of some of his collection of erotic art is investigated by Morse and Lewis.

roles.char: Man sitting near the Master in the opening scene

title: The Last Enemy
description: A headless, armless, footless body of a murdered academic is found in Oxford Canal and his investigation leads to petty hatred and jealousy among the local academia.

roles.char: Man walking along canal bank in opening scene

title: Deceived by Flight
description: Lewis goes undercover as a worker at the University so he can go undercover on the cricket team and discover the murderer of Morse's old college roommate.

roles.char: Man Walking Behind Lewis and Roland in College

title: The Secret of Bay 5B
description: A bullying, controlling womanizer who also blackmails his conquests is found garroted in his car in a garage deck.

title: The Infernal Serpent
description: An environmentalist professor is mugged and later dies of a heart attack after an attack on campus just prior to a controversial debate.

title: The Sins of the Fathers
description: The managing director and heir apparent to a venerable family-owned brewery in dire financial straits is found drowned in a vat of his own ale.

title: Driven to Distraction
description: After two beautiful women are stabbed to death a month apart by the same killer, the only connection between the pair is their car dealership.

roles.char: Man in launderette with Tim Ablett and Angie Howe

title: Masonic Mysteries
description: Morse finds himself framed for murder by an unknown mastermind and suspended as Lewis is seconded to DCI Bottomley, who is in charge of the case.

roles.char: Man in choir next to Morse

title: Second Time Around
description: Morse links the killing of a police lieutenant on the night of his retirement to the 18 year old cold case murder of an 8 year old girl.

roles.char: Man at Trout Inn when Morse meets Barbara Redpath

title: Fat Chance
description: After a young woman aspiring to the priesthood dies while taking her exams, possibly from poison, Morse connects the death to a weight loss company.

roles.char: Man in college grounds when Hilary Dobson goes in for interview

title: Who Killed Harry Field?
description: Struggling artist Harry Field is found murdered and thrown off an overpass but recent rains and a dry body lead Morse to conclude he was killed over a week earlier.

roles.char: Man in group when Ian Matthews presents Morse with postcard

title: Greeks Bearing Gifts
description: Among the suspects in the murder of a Greek chef and his sister are a Ancient Greek scholar, a dodgy British entrepreneur, and a Greek shipping magnate.

roles.char: Man in college porter's lodge when Morse leaves after dinner with Jerome Hogg

title: Promised Land
description: Morse and Lewis go to Austrailia to find a witness who has been in witness protection for ten years, but this is one witness who doesn't want to be found.

title: Dead on Time
description: A respected, dying Oxford don, husband of Morse's former fiancée, apparently shoots himself, but his doctor asserts that he was not capable of firing a gun.

roles.char: Man at Reception After Schubert Concert

title: Happy Families
description: The head of a wealthy but dysfunctional family is found bludgeoned to death in the family estate as Morse is forced to deal with the resultant media frenzy.

roles.char: Tramp Drinking from Bottle Near Mitre Pub

title: The Death of the Self
description: Morse looks to mix a little pleasure with business when he and Lewis are sent to Italy to look into the suspicious death of an English woman near Vicenza.

roles.char: Man three seats to Morse's left in closing opera scene

title: Absolute Conviction
description: A convicted fraudster, one of three former business partners at an open prison, dies following an assault. Morse has to investigate the death while dealing with a brash subordinate and trying to avoid offending the prison authorities.

roles.char: Man in prison church when Brian Thornton preaches

title: Cherubim & Seraphim
description: A new drug developed to combat senility is ironically being distributed to teens at all-night parties and driving some to suicide.

roles.char: Man next to Dr. Collier at presentation

title: Deadly Slumber
description: When the head of a medical clinic is found asphyxiated in his garage, the father of a one of his brain-dead patients becomes the prime suspect.

roles.char: College porter showing Morse and Lewis to John Brewster

title: The Day of the Devil
description: A sociopathic but clever murderer who believes in the occult escapes from prison and returns to Oxford, and it is up to Morse to stop him.

title: Twilight of the Gods
description: When Gwladys Probert, a world renowned mezzo-soprano, is shot by a sniper at Oxford, Morse, one of her biggest fans, sees a link with an earlier murder of a freelance journalist.

roles.char: Man in Sheldonian Theatre Behind Lord Hinksey

title: The Way Through the Woods
description: When a serial killer is murdered in prison, his deathbed confession disavows one of the murders he had previously confessed to. Morse wants to reopen the case.

title: The Daughters of Cain
description: An Oxford professor and fund raiser is stabbed to death at home with a weapon that is yet to be stolen from a university museum.

title: Death Is Now My Neighbour
description: When the next-door neighbor of a murdered woman is also killed, Morse suspects the first shooting may have been an error.

title: The Wench Is Dead
description: While Morse is in hospital for a bleeding ulcer, he takes an interest in an 1859 murder and becomes convinced its resolution was a miscarriage of justice.

title: The Remorseful Day
description: An ailing Morse involves himself in a year old cold murder case of a nymphomaniac is when persons of interest connected with it turn up dead.
